name: London Marriott Hotel Regents Park

reviews.text: Great large, clean room! Close to the tube and great attractions.
reviews.title: Large room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a Marriott Guy; in fact I am Platinum Elite. Not going to stay at that level because my company has started to throw fits over what they charge for hotels -- especially outside the US.
reviews.title: Solid Value, But...

reviews.text: This is a hotel that I like to stay at in London. Solid value for the money, and I like the neighborhood. However this most recent stay underscored how dowdy the chain has become. The hotel is just plain worn out thanks to a ton of deferred maintenance. It is also expensive compared to even other chains. Still a lot more affordable than Central London though!
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: Lots of inexpensive eating options on Finchley Road if you are willing to walk 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a family trip

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, the staff were very friendly and helpfull from the moment we arrived untill we left.
reviews.title: Thumbs-up!
Don't be put off by the outside appearance
reviews.text: So it is a bit of a hike from Swiss Cottage underground to the hotel which is in a residential area in what looks like an ugly block of flats.
Inside though it is a Marriott. The lobby was nice enough as were the rooms.
reviews.title: Too many problems

reviews.text: No free wi-fi which I would expect
reviews.title: Good value and nice quiet location for the money

reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was nice but like most hotels way over priced when you don't really want much.
reviews.title: Great return trip to the Marriott

reviews.text: Took a walk around the neighbourhood to find some food. Not a lot on offer. This looks like a great area to live but may not be what you are looking for in a holiday hotel location. Though once you are on the tube it is not so far to Waterloo etc. So if you can get this for a lower price than central hotels it may be a good option.
reviews.title: A little bit outside the city center but great value

reviews.text: Good quality Marriott for location and get into London easily (West End via Jubilee, Metropolitan (Finchley Road) for the City. The hotel suffers from being on a major road and the hotel rooms (including its double glazing) needs a bit of updating.
reviews.title: Good service, decent location, can be noisy

reviews.text: I stay there frequently on business. Generally 50:50 you can get a quiet or noisy room. If you ask for quiet the friendly staff will do their up most to help you. The Executive Lounge is very busy but well stocked on a night and Betty is a great hostess. Breakfast in it on a morning is a little limited - the lounge is a little cramped.
reviews.title: An unexpected surprise at a bargain

reviews.text: They have a decent sized gym with good kit. The pool is more of a splash around pool - usually too many tourists in it to do any length swimming. Main restaurant is decent - although in nearly two years the menu has pretty much stayed the same (incl. in the bar). The food is always pretty good though even if the menu is a bit limited.
reviews.title: Gem of a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the best thing about this Marriott with 20 minute tube links to centre of London is the size of the rooms. They are very large, frequently with two doubles and space to spare. This is a rarity for the price in London.
reviews.title: Nice overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a GREAT family hotel "near" london. Don't let the location fool you, it is in the "Swiss Cottage" area, but only 4 stops on the Jubilee line to Westminster. From the outside the hotel doesn't look very appealing, but the rooms are large and great for a family. Considerably less expensive than anywhere closer in the city. I've styed in a nunber of hotels in London, the K&K Earl's Court (nice hotel), the Rubens (great hotel for couples), the Hilton on Tooley street (good for business), the Indigo Tower Hill (avoid) and others. For traveling with a family, I would put this above all the rest. Definitely pay the extra for the concierage service. The breakfast, cocktail hour, and water anytime of the day is well worth it, especially for a family.
reviews.title: Disappointed yet good enough

reviews.text: The hotel was under construction, so the escalator sometines took a little while, but amongst this, the hotel was excellent, no noise to hear, beautiful rooms, really big for the family. Nice people at desk and for breakfast seating.
reviews.title: Excellent stay as family for a short weekend trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is fairly convenient, the staff was friendly and quick with the check-in/check-out process. No complaints with the service. Room was a good size and clean as one would normally expect. On the down side, we heard ambulance sirens throughout the entire night, and if you are a light sleeper, you will hear local traffic quite easily. Also, it should be noted that it is a bit of a walk to get to Regents Park, but that did not concern us.
reviews.title: Decent Location, Decent Value

reviews.text: the hotel has a good location, good staff, rooms are big and comfortable, breakfast is of good standard. Value for money. however, night menu is limited and not so good, and does not have much choice.
reviews.title: Fairly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall happy with my stay
reviews.title: Bloody Sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK...it's started with check-in. Granted I arrived at noon and my room wasn't ready so we went to the Executive Lounge. After 90 minutes I went down and was told my room was ready. I go to the room to find 2 double beds instead of the king I was guaranteed. Down I go to reception and the girl looks at me and asks if I was sure there were 2 beds in the room and not a king. I think most people would be able to tell the difference. So, again we wait and finally get into our room, First, the in room fridge doesn't work so they bring in one and put it by the closet. Heaven forbid they just switch one out! Next, no toiletries...for FOUR days...even with speaking to the front desk every day. The worst though, was when we had the sheets changed. We get back to the room and head for bed around 11:00pm. I turn back the sheets and there's blood on them! Blood!!! I had to put towels down in order to sleep in the bed. I complain the next day and guess what I'm told...they've got some new housekeeping staff. Come on! An idiot would know that if you've got blood on a fresh sheet, don't just leave it...change it!! I'm STILL waiting to hear back from Marriott.
reviews.title: Great Hotel -10mins from Central London by Tube

description: The London Marriott Hotel Regents Park provides a convenient base for any astute business traveller and leisure guest. This 4 star north London hotel in zone 2 offers competitive rates combined with a close proximity to the city centre. Located only a 3 minute walk from Swiss Cottage underground station on the Jubilee Line, the hotel is perfect for shoppers, visitors to the city and sports fans alike. It has a direct connection to Wembley Stadium, Lord’s Cricket Ground, Bond Street, Buckingham Palace, Parliament Square and Canary Wharf. In addition, the hive of activity that is Camden Town, ZSL’s London Zoo and the chic shops, cafés and restaurants of Primrose Hill are all just a short walk or bus ride away.The hotel has 304 spacious bedrooms, including 157 twin bedrooms with two double beds. The Leisure Club’s extensive onsite facilities benefit from a 15m swimming pool, sauna, steam room, solarium, gym and hair and beauty salons. Additional services include the Indian restaurant Zaike NW3, Chats bar, 24 hour room service and on-site car parking.
